CHILDHOOD: Jamieson grew up in Kitchener Canada. He spent his childhood summers playing on the beaches of Lake Huron in a town called Kincardine. Btw if you ever want to chat about something else, just say 'done'. %[I want to learn about his education](postback:education)
I WANT MORE DETAILS ABOUT HIS FAMILY:
His parents we're married in 1966 and recently celebrated their 50th anniversary.
His sister lives in Toronto and works as a teacher and he has two nieces in Toronto and one in Calgary
EDUCATION:
Jamieson went to university and got a degree in Geography, While he was a student he discovered the then new web and a lifelong journey began.
After university, Jamieson felt the need for an adventure and ended up moving to London without previously being visiting. Needless to say he found his adventure, and his career. %[Why London?](postback:why_london) %[Why User Experience?](postback:why_user_experience)
WHY LONDON?:
Jamieson had a grandmother who was born in London, which meant he was able to gain a work visa. 
While in London, and working for a marketing agency in Notting Hill, Jamieson had a conversation with a person long forgotten that introduced him to the idea of working online. Soon after Jamieson became one of the early professional web designers in the UK. %[Channel Four](postback:channel_four) %[Sony Europe](postback:sony_europe) %[APL/Zentropy](postback:apl_zentropy)
CHANNEL FOUR:
Jamieson was employed as the Channel 4 Web Manager in charge of online educational programming. 
Basically, he designed websites for home improvement programs, gardening and cooking programs and Sesame Street. 
In addition to this, Jamieson collaborated with the British Dyslexia Society in creating the first dyslexia friendly online presence, years before text readers were created. This created an interest in highly accessible online experiences that continue to this day. %[Sony Europe](postback:sony_europe) %[APL/Zentropy](postback:apl_zentropy)
SONY EUROPE: Jamieson worked for Sony Interactive Europe as a web designer. While there he was responsible for designing microsites and landing pages for Playstation Games, site support for the Playstation Two site and game reviews. %[Channel Four](postback:channel_four) %[APL/Zentropy](postback:apl_zentropy)
APL ZENTROPY: APL Digital was where Jamieson got to work with some really big brands, The first digital agency in the UK, APL Digital worked with brands like Nestle, Mini Cooper, Unilever, Maybelline and Hewlett Packard. Jamieson was there when APL became Zentropy and in highsight it all felt too short for such an amazing experience. %[Channel Four](postback:channel_four) %[Sony Europe](postback:sony_europe)
